title: Technology
description: Washington Post technology news.

title: For Google’s Pixel 7 phones, fixing little annoyances is a big deal
dc:creator: Chris Velazco
description: Google unveiled a pair of new Pixel 7 smartphones on Thursday and they're designed, in part, to fix mundane annoyances of phone life we’ve learned to put up with.

title: Prominent influencer sues TikTok over ads she says misused her image
dc:creator: Taylor Lorenz
description: Online influencer and reality TV star Bethenny Frankel alleges that TikTok moved too slowly to remove fake ads that showed her promoting a product she had nothing to do with.

title: Former Uber security chief convicted of covering up 2016 data breach
dc:creator: Joseph Menn
description: The case was the first brought against a corporate executive over a breach by outsiders. It also may be the last — the payoff that prompted the charges has become common practice in hacking cases.

title: For Google’s Pixel 7 phones, fixing little annoyances is a big deal
dc:creator: Chris Velazco
description: Google unveiled a pair of new Pixel 7 smartphones on Thursday and they're designed, in part, to fix mundane annoyances of phone life we’ve learned to put up with.

title: Prominent influencer sues TikTok over ads she says misused her image
dc:creator: Taylor Lorenz
description: Online influencer and reality TV star Bethenny Frankel alleges that TikTok moved too slowly to remove fake ads that showed her promoting a product she had nothing to do with.

title: Former Uber security chief convicted of covering up 2016 data breach
dc:creator: Joseph Menn
description: The case was the first brought against a corporate executive over a breach by outsiders. It also may be the last — the payoff that prompted the charges has become common practice in hacking cases.

title: SpaceX launch is latest sign of lasting Russia-U.S. space partnership
dc:creator: Christian Davenport
description: The latest SpaceX launch included two NASA astronauts, one Russian cosmonaut and one Japanese astronaut.

title: Here’s what Elon Musk has said about his plans for Twitter
dc:creator: Rachel Lerman
description: Elon Musk has said he wants to promote free speech on Twitter and open up the algorithm to increase transparency. Here's what else he has shared about his plans.

title: ‘Overwatch 2’ launch plagued by DDoS attacks and disconnects
dc:creator: Jonathan Lee
description: The highly anticipated sequel suffered another setback in its development just as it went live.

title: Political spam is out of control. Now Gmail is about to make it worse.
dc:creator: Geoffrey A. Fowler
description: Campaign emails will soon get to bypass Gmail’s spam filter. Here's how you can banish them from your inbox and make democracy less annoying online.

title: Sharper than on PS4, ‘Nier: Automata’ on Switch remains virtuosic
dc:creator: Gene Park
description: One of the best games ever made lands on Nintendo's handheld.

title: Elon Musk may soon own Twitter. What might it look like when he does?
dc:creator: Elizabeth Dwoskin
description: The Tesla CEO’s fresh offer to buy Twitter for $44 billion represents a win for the firm’s board. But Musk is almost sure to transform the company.

title: New Cyberpunk and Witcher video games announced by CD Projekt
dc:creator: Jonathan Lee
description: In a Twitter thread, the company revealed Orion, Polaris, Canis Majoris and other codenames for upcoming Witcher and Cyberpunk projects.

title: Elon Musk offers to buy Twitter for original price, weeks before trial
dc:creator: Faiz Siddiqui
description: The offer marks the latest twist in a months-long campaign by Musk to acquire the influential social media platform.

title: Facebook closes down service it hoped would compete with Substack
dc:creator: Taylor Lorenz
description: The decision to shut down Bulletin is an indication that Facebook found a subscriber-focused site was not as lucrative as hoped.

title: What Europe’s push to simplify chargers means for you
dc:creator: Chris Velazco
description: Europe’s push to end cord confusion could extend well beyond its borders.

title: Chipmaker Micron to build $20 billion N.Y. factory amid semiconductor boom
dc:creator: Jeanne Whalen
description: Micron will invest $20 billion in a new chip factory, and potentially up to $100 billion in additional plants, in Upstate New York in another sign of a semiconductor manufacturing boom.

title: Sheryl Sandberg’s next chapter: Pledging millions to fight abortion bans
dc:creator: Elizabeth Dwoskin
description: Sandberg's announcement of her donation to the ACLU to fight abortion bans comes just a few days after she leaves Meta.

title: In bed with the Apple Watch Series 8 and its new temperature sensor
dc:creator: Chris Velazco
description: Apple has crammed even more sensors into its new Watch 8 series, all in the hopes of offering a more complete picture of your health. Are they worth it?

title: U.S. crafting new rules aimed at curbing China’s advanced computing
dc:creator: Ellen Nakashima
description: The United States is preparing to use a draconian export ban called the foreign direct product rule to deprive China of advanced computing chips.

title: Labor board says Activision withheld raises from union activists
dc:creator: Shannon Liao
description: The National Labor Relations Board found merit in a claim Activision Blizzard withheld raises from Raven QA testers seeking to unionize.

title: Fight over social media’s role in terror content goes to Supreme Court
dc:creator: Rachel Lerman
description: A case involving Google and an ISIS attack in Paris in 2015 will give the high court a chance to review Section 230, the controversial law that shields websites from liability for users’ posts.

title: How to vet mental health advice on TikTok and Instagram
dc:creator: Tatum Hunter
description: Not all information about mental health on TikTok, Instagram and YouTube is helpful and true. Here are six questions to ask as you scroll.
